title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Education
body: Brown v. Board of Education: Fairness and Equality The Education Department at Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site strives to provide quality curriculum-based resources and activities for educators and parents. Information is available related to the Brown v. Board of Education U.S. Supreme Court case, the Civil Rights Movement, education, African American history and cultural and social justice.                 Curriculum Materials for Students of All Ages Whether your teaching students about fairness in kindergarten or the struggle for equality to high school seniors, find curriculum materials here. Read More        Plan A Field Trip Choose a from a variety of field trip topics for students of all ages. Bus grants may be available. Read More        Distance Learning Programs Interact with a Ranger from your school using videoconference technology. Choose from selected programs or have the Ranger present a specific topic. Read More        Lesson Plans for K-12 Teachers Download a lesson plan to use in the classroom before a site visit or to meet standards. Read More
